item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (239 points | 88 comments)
2. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (127 points | 47 comments)
3. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (157 points | 67 comments)
4. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (119 points | 16 comments)
5. The Double Irish Dutch Sandwich: End of a Tax Evasion Strategy (81 points | 71 comments)
6. TexTube: Chat with any YouTube video transcript in ChatGPT fast (58 points | 38 comments)
7. Zep AI (YC W24) Is Hiring Standout AI Engineers ( | hide)
8. Show HN: Will I run Boston 2025? (14 points | 4 comments)
9. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (253 points | 23 comments)
10. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (125 points | 44 comments)
11. Swift 6 (255 points | 135 comments)
12. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (79 points | 7 comments)
13. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (86 points | 59 comments)
14. WonderWorld: Interactive 3D Scene Generation from a Single Image (87 points | 10 comments)
15. STORM: Get a Wikipedia-like report on your topic (33 points | 26 comments)
16. The centrality of stupidity in mathematics (197 points | 114 comments)
17. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (188 points | 44 comments)
18. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (504 points | 1256 comments)
19. Krazam: High Agency Individual Contributor [video] (110 points | 20 comments)
20. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (87 points | 28 comments)
21. Signatures of gravitational atoms from black hole mergers (91 points | 48 comments)
22. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (86 points | 56 comments)
23. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (62 points | 12 comments)
24. Things you should know about Windows Input, but would rather not (142 points | 82 comments)
25. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (11 points | discuss)
26. Quote Origin: I had exactly four seconds and Google had told me it wasn’t enough (235 points | 105 comments)
27. Tcl under fire: report suggests its QLED TVs might not have any quantum dots (18 points | 13 comments)
28. A Curried Composition Puzzle (81 points | 10 comments)
29. The theft of a Churchill portrait (52 points | 22 comments)
30. Old Computing Books (25 points | 6 comments)
